pwa_features.title: Bamako
pwa_features.description: Works for every user, regardless of browser choice because they’re built with progressive enhancement as a core tenant.

pwa_features.title: Koulikoro
pwa_features.description: Enhanced with service workers to work offline or on low-quality networks.

pwa_features.title: Sikasso
pwa_features.description: Feels like an app to the user with app-style interactions and navigation.

pwa_features.title: Ségou
pwa_features.description: Always up-to-date thanks to the service worker update process.

pwa_features.title: Mopti
pwa_features.description: Because a PWA has a more intimate user experience and because all network requests can be intercepted through service workers, it is a must to host the PWA over HTTPS to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks.

pwa_features.title: Toumbouctou
pwa_features.description: Because a progressive web app is a website, it should be discoverable in search engines. This is a major advantage over native applications, which still lag behind websites in searchability.

pwa_features.title: Gao
pwa_features.description: Makes re-engagement easy through features like push notifications.

pwa_features.title: Koutiala
pwa_features.description: Allows users to 'keep' apps they find most useful on their home screen without the hassle of an app store middleman.

pwa_features.title: Ménaka
pwa_features.description: Easily shareable via URLs. Another characteristic inherited from websites, a well-designed website should use the URI to indicate its current state. This enables the web app to retain or reload its state when the user bookmarks or shares the app’s URL.
